question: Nice to meet you Kotono Nagase-san. What kind of life do you have as a student?
reply: Y...Yes. Even at school, I practice during my lunch breaks. I'm with Nagisa a lot of the time.

question: Are you nervous right now?
reply: Yeah, I guess so. I haven't had many interviews yet...

question: Try to relax please. Do you have a favorite subject in school?
reply: Gymnastics. I can't really say that, can I? If I had to choose, then history...I guess.

question: You can say Physical Education, it's fine. It's a bit surprising that you like history, why do you like it?
reply: Aren't old stories interesting? It's fun to learn about everything that has happened.

question: I see. So, on the opposite side of things, what are your weakest subjects?
reply: Mathematics and physics...I'm not good with numbers.

question: How do you study for tests?
reply: Nagisa and I study together often. To be honest, I'm not very good with tests...

question: You've mentioned Nagisa-san already, but among the members, who is your best friend?
reply: It has to Nagisa. She is one of the only friends I've had since middle school.

question: So, do you have a rival?
reply: Rival, huh? Well...Sakura might be my rival. She surprises me in so many ways; I can't lose to her. But, of course, we're not on bad terms.

question: You're good rivals, aren't you? Have you had any moments in your career where you felt a bond with the others?
reply: A bond...? We're all serious about becoming top idols, so I guess you might feel a bond between us in that sense.

question: That's amazing. I get the sense that you're not just an idol group. In your mind, you're thinking "This is the only place I can't lose to anyone!". What are some of the advantages of being an idol?
reply: I don't know if I'm as good as anyone else, but I won't lose my motivation to become a top idol.

question: Oh--. I get the feeling that you're very determined. When did you become an idol in the first place?
reply: It was after I entered high school...

question: So it was surprisingly recent then. Was it hard to get to this point? What's the hardest thing you've ever done?
reply: I wonder... It has to be the singing after all, but I still think I haven't worked hard enough.

question: I see. By the way, which do you like better: singing or dancing?
reply: My favorite is dancing. Singing is difficult.

question: Thank you. Now, I'd like to ask you a little bit about your personal life. What is the first thing you do when you wake up in the morning?
reply: This won't be very interesting to listen to though...? Normally, it would be washing my face.

question: No, no, don't say that. I think the fans would want to know. Are you a bread or rice person in the morning?
reply: I think it's rice. But I serve bread when it's my turn to make breakfast.

question: Is that right? When you're making breakfast, what kind of food do you usually make?
reply: I hardly ever cook, I'm not very good at it. That's why I serve bread.

question: I thing we should start talking about cooking now. What is your favorite food?
reply: Don't laugh, okay? ...C...Cotton candy is my favorite.

question: Oh--, I'm surprised. Why do you like it?
reply: When I was little, my family went to a festival and I got lost. Then, my sister came to look for me and bought me some cotton candy. The cotton candy I had that day was so delicious, that was what started my love for it.

question: The festival was the Hoshimi Festival?
reply: Yeah, that's right. Now, it is a festival that holds many memories for me.

question: I'm sure it is. Do you have a favorite place in your hometown, Hoshimi City?
reply: I like the beach at night. I like to be in a quiet place and just listen to the sound of the waves.

question: I can understand that. Then, moving on, what is your favorite color?
reply: I like a black-ish blue. Maybe a color like the night sky suits me most.

question: That certainly sounds like you. What do you do on your days off?
reply: I generally practice on my own...I'm sorry, it's not very fun.

question: That's not true. Is there anything that has been troubling you lately?
reply: There are many things. How to use your fingertips while dancing, how to use my voice properly...

question: You've been thinking about idols for a long time, haven't you? What was your dream when you were little?
reply: When I was little, it was my dream to be a pianist. I was influenced by my mother though.

question: Was it your sister's influence that made you want to become an idol?
reply: Yeah.....I guess so. If it wasn't for my sister, I don't think I would have become an idol.

question: I see. Is she your ideal idol?
reply: I wish I could be a great idol like my sister, but this is just the beginning.

question: Thank you. What is the most important thing for you in your idol career?
reply: The hardest thing...it has to be being able to perform with all your energy and force, I guess.

question: So, what does a stage performance or a live performance mean to you, Kotono-san?
reply: To me, it's a place that gives me life.

question: That's deep. What do you think you would have done if you hadn't become an idol?
reply: If I hadn't become one, I would be a piano teacher or something like that. But I think I'm doing all I can to become an idol.

question: Impressive. You're extremely determined. Do you remember your debut concert?
reply: Of course, I remember it.

question: How did you feel during it?
reply: I was both excited and nervous, it was a very strange feeling. I starting feeling like "This is where it all begins".

question: You weren't that happy?
reply: That's not it. I was very happy, but I was just as nervous as I was happy.

question: By the way, what is the happiest moment for you, in your life?
reply: I guess it was our debut. I was so happy that people came to see us.

question: On the other hand, what was the most frustrating moment?
When I saw LizNoir's performance, I felt disappointed in my own performance.
Thank you. I'd like to ask you about your music, but do you have a favorite genre of music?
reply: Genre? I wonder...? I don't listen to music much so I don't know.

question: That's right. So, what was your first impression of "Shine Purity ~Kagayaki no Jundo~" when you heard it for the first time?
reply: I thought it was a nice song.

question: If you had to describe "Shine Purity" in one word, how would you describe it?
reply: A song of the beginning.

question: What is your favorite lyric in "Shine Purity"?
reply: The part that is "I hope strongly, what I aim for is not enough". It's not just about wishing, it's about being prepared and willing to go for that goal seriously. That's what makes me tense up.

question: I think that was a very Kotono-san-like choice. What dream do you want to achieve with Hoshimi Productions?
reply: I want to become a top idol.

question: That's right, isn't it? If your dreams come true, who would you want to tell first?
reply: My sister...

question: What would you like to say to yourself in 10 years time?
reply: "Has your dream.......come true?"...It would be something like that?

question: It's okay. To put it simply, what does it mean to be an idol, Kotono-san?
reply: That's a difficult question. I hate it...I love it...I can't put it into words very well. Sorry.

question: I think that's fine. What kind of people are your fans to you, Kotono-san?
reply: The fans...they're the ones who make us shine.

question: Thank you very much. Lastly, could you give a message to your fans?
reply: A message? Well...thank you for all the support. I'll do my best do give you the best lives possible, so please keep supporting us. ....Is that good enough?
